Text: he is liable on summary conviction to a fine not exceeding level 4 on the standard scale.
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (7)Proceedings in respect of an offence under paragraph (6) may, despite anything in Article 19 of the Magistrates' Courts (Northern Ireland) Order 1981 (limitation of time), be commenced at any time within two years from the date of the commission of the offence or within six months of its first discovery by the applicant, whichever period expires earlier.
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (8)Paragraphs (1)(e) and (4) to (7) do not apply in the case of an order specifying an authority as liable to pay the compensation.
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: 36ZCParental compensation orders: supplemental(1)Before deciding whether or not to make a parental compensation order in favour of any person, the magistrates' court shall take into account the views of that person about whether a parental compensation order should be made in his favour.
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (2)Before making a parental compensation order, the magistrates' court shall obtain and consider information about the child's family circumstances and the likely effect of the order on those circumstances.
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (3)Before making a parental compensation order, a magistrates' court shall explain to the parent or guardian of the child in ordinary language—
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (a)the effect of the order and of the requirements proposed to be included in it;
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (b)the consequences which may follow (under paragraph (4)(b)) as a result of failure to comply with any of those requirements;
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (c)that the court has power (under paragraph (4)(a)) to review the order on the application either of the parent or guardian or of the applicant.
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (4)A magistrates' court which has made a parental compensation order may make an order under paragraph (5) if while the order is in force—
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (a)it appears to the court, on the application of the applicant, or the parent or guardian subject to the order, that it is appropriate to make an order under paragraph (5); or
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (b)it is proved to the satisfaction of the court, on the application of the applicant, that the parent or guardian subject to it has failed to comply with any requirement included in the order.
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (5)An order under this paragraph is an order discharging the parental compensation order or varying it—
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (a)by cancelling any provision included in it; or
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (b)by inserting in it (either in addition to or in substitution for any of its provisions) any provision that could have been included in the order if the court had then had power to make it and were exercising the power.
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (6)Where an application under paragraph (4) for the discharge of a parental compensation order is dismissed, no further application for its discharge shall be made under that paragraph by any person except with the consent of the court which made the order.
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (7)References in this Article to the magistrates' court which made a parental compensation order include any magistrates' court acting for the same county court division as that court.
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: 36ZDParental compensation orders: appeal(1)If a magistrates' court makes a parental compensation order, the parent or guardian may appeal against the making of the order, or against the amount of compensation specified in the order.
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (2)The appeal lies to the county court.
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (3)On the appeal the county court—
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (a)may make such orders as may be necessary to give effect to its determination of the appeal;
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (b)may also make such incidental or consequential orders as appear to it to be just.
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (4)Any order of the county court made on an appeal under this Article (other than one directing that an application be re-heard by a magistrates' court) shall, for the purposes of Article 36ZC, be treated as if it were an order of the magistrates' court from which the appeal was brought and not an order of the county court.
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (5)A person in whose favour a parental compensation order is made shall not be entitled to receive any compensation under it until (disregarding any power of a court to grant leave to appeal out of time) there is no further possibility of an appeal on which the order could be varied or set aside.
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: 36ZEEffect of parental compensation order on subsequent award of damages in civil proceedings(1)This Article has effect where—
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (a)a parental compensation order has been made in favour of any person in respect of any taking or loss of property or damage to it; and
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (b)a claim by him in civil proceedings for damages in respect of the taking, loss or damage is then to be determined.
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (2)The damages in the civil proceedings shall be assessed without regard to the parental compensation order, but the claimant may recover only an amount equal to the aggregate of the following—
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (a)any amount by which they exceed the compensation; and
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (b)a sum equal to any portion of the compensation which he fails to recover.
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (3)The claimant may not enforce the judgment, so far as it relates to such a sum as is mentioned in paragraph (2)(b), without the leave of the court.”
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: 9N.I.In Article 2 (interpretation), in paragraph (2), in the appropriate place insert—““parental compensation order” has the meaning given by Article 36ZA(1);”.
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: 10N.I.The amendments made by paragraph 8 of this Schedule do not apply in relation to any conduct which occurred before the coming into force of that paragraph.Section 159SCHEDULE 11E+WInvestigations into conduct of police officers: accelerated procedure in special cases1E+WSchedule 3 to the Police Reform Act 2002 (c. 30) is amended as follows.Commencement InformationI316Sch. 11 para. 1 in force at 1.7.2005 by S.I. 2005/1521, art. 3(1)(v)2E+WIn paragraph 20(1)—(a)for “until” substitute “until— (a)the appropriate authority has certified the case as a special case under paragraph 20B(3) or 20E(3), or”; and
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (b)the words from “a report” to the end become paragraph (b).Commencement InformationI317Sch. 11 para. 2 in force at 1.7.2005 by S.I. 2005/1521, art. 3(1)(v)F1913E+W. . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .Textual AmendmentsF191Sch. 11 para. 3 omitted (31.1.2017 for specified purposes, 1.2.2020 in so far as not already in force) by virtue of Policing and Crime Act 2017 (c. 3), s. 183(1)(5)(e), Sch. 5 para. 48(a); S.I. 2020/5, reg. 2(n) (with reg. 3(1)(2)(4))F1924E+W. . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .Textual AmendmentsF192Sch. 11 para. 4 omitted (31.1.2017 for specified purposes, 1.2.2020 in so far as not already in force) by virtue of Policing and Crime Act 2017 (c. 3), s. 183(1)(5)(e), Sch. 5 para. 48(a); S.I. 2020/5, reg. 2(n) (with reg. 3(1)(2)(4))Section 160SCHEDULE 12E+WInvestigations of deaths and serious injuries during or after contact with the police1E+WThe Police Reform Act 2002 (c. 30) has effect subject to the following amendments.Commencement InformationI318Sch. 12 para. 1 in force at 1.7.2005 by S.I. 2005/1521, art. 3(1)(w)2(1)Section 10(2) (general functions of the Commission) is amended as follows.E+W(2)After paragraph (b) insert—“(ba)the recording of matters from which it appears that a person has died or suffered serious injury during, or following, contact with a person serving with the police;”.
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (3)In paragraph (c), after “paragraph (b)” insert “ or (ba) ”.Commencement InformationI319Sch. 12 para. 2 in force at 1.7.2005 by S.I. 2005/1521, art. 3(1)(w)3E+WIn section 12 (matters to which Part 2 applies), after subsection (2) insert—“(2A)In this Part “death or serious injury matter” (or “DSI matter” for short) means any circumstances (other than those which are or have been the subject of a complaint or which amount to a conduct matter)—
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (a)in or in consequence of which a person has died or has sustained serious injury; and
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (b)in relation to which the requirements of either subsection (2B) or subsection (2C) are satisfied.
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (2B)The requirements of this subsection are that at the time of the death or serious injury the person—
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (a)had been arrested by a person serving with the police and had not been released from that arrest; or
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (b)was otherwise detained in the custody of a person serving with the police.
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (2C)The requirements of this subsection are that—
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (a)at or before the time of the death or serious injury the person had contact (of whatever kind, and whether direct or indirect) with a person serving with the police who was acting in the execution of his duties; and
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (b)there is an indication that the contact may have caused (whether directly or indirectly) or contributed to the death or serious injury.
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (2D)In subsection (2A) the reference to a person includes a person serving with the police, but in relation to such a person “contact” in subsection (2C) does not include contact that he has whilst acting in the execution of his duties.”
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: Commencement InformationI320Sch. 12 para. 3 in force at 1.7.2005 by S.I. 2005/1521, art. 3(1)(w)4E+WIn the following provisions, for “and conduct matters” substitute “ , conduct matters and DSI matters ”(a)the cross-heading preceding section 13;(b)the heading for section 13 (handling of complaints and conduct matters); and(c)that section itself.Commencement InformationI321Sch. 12 para. 4 in force at 1.7.2005 by S.I. 2005/1521, art. 3(1)(w)5(1)Section 16(2) (assistance for which payment is required) is amended as follows.E+W(2)In paragraph (a), for the words from “an investigation relating to” to the end substitute—“(i)an investigation relating to the conduct of a person who, at the time of the conduct, was a member of the other force, or
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (ii)an investigation of a DSI matter in relation to which the relevant officer was, at the time of the death or serious injury, a member of the other force; and”.
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (3)In paragraph (b), for the words from “an investigation” to the end substitute—“(i)an investigation relating to the conduct of a person who, at the time of the conduct, was not a member of that force, or
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (ii)an investigation of a DSI matter in relation to which the relevant officer was, at the time of the death or serious injury, not a member of that force.”
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: Commencement InformationI322Sch. 12 para. 5 in force at 1.7.2005 by S.I. 2005/1521, art. 3(1)(w)6E+WIn section 18 (inspection of police premises on behalf of the Commission), in subsection (2)(a), after “conduct matters” insert “ or DSI matters ”.Commencement InformationI323Sch. 12 para. 6 in force at 1.7.2005 by S.I. 2005/1521, art. 3(1)(w)7(1)Section 21 (duty to provide information) is amended as follows.E+W(2)In subsection (1), for “or recordable conduct matter” substitute “ , recordable conduct matter or DSI matter ”.(3)In subsection (1)(a), after “subsection (2)” insert “ or (2A) ”.(4)In subsection (2), after “if” insert “ (in the case of a complaint or recordable conduct matter) ”.(5)After subsection (2) insert—“(2A)A person falls within this subsection if (in the case of a DSI matter)—
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (a)he is a relative of the person who has died;
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (b)he is a relative of the person who has suffered serious injury and that person is incapable of making a complaint;
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (c)he himself is the person who has suffered serious injury.”
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (6)In subsection (3)—(a)after “subsection (2)” insert “ or (2A) ”; and(b)for “or recordable conduct matter” (in both places) substitute “ , recordable conduct matter or DSI matter ”.(7)In subsection (5), for “or conduct matter” substitute “ , conduct matter or DSI matter ”.(8)In subsections (6) and (7), for “or recordable conduct matter” substitute “ , recordable conduct matter or DSI matter ”.(9)After subsection (9)(b) insert—“(ba)whether the Commission or the appropriate authority has made a determination under paragraph 21A of Schedule 3;”.
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (10)In subsection (9)(c), after “paragraph 22” insert “ or 24A ”.(11)In subsection (10), for “or recordable conduct matter” substitute “ , recordable conduct matter or DSI matter ”.Commencement InformationI324Sch. 12 para. 7 in force at 1.7.2005 by S.I. 2005/1521, art. 3(1)(w)8(1)Section 22 (power of Commission to issue guidance) is amended as follows.E+W(2)In subsection (2)(b)(ii), after “recordable conduct matters” insert “ or DSI matters ”.(3)In subsection (5)—(a)in paragraph (a), after “recordable conduct matters” insert “ or DSI matters ”;(b)in paragraphs (b) and (d)(ii), after “recordable conduct matter” insert “ or DSI matter ”; and(c)in paragraph (e)(i), for “or conduct matter” substitute “ , conduct matter or DSI matter ”.Commencement InformationI325Sch. 12 para. 8 in force at 1.7.2005 by S.I. 2005/1521, art. 3(1)(w)9(1)Section 23(2) (regulations) is amended as follows.E+W(2)In paragraph (b), after “recordable conduct matters” insert “ and DSI matters ”.(3)For paragraph (h) substitute—“(h)for combining into a single investigation the investigation of any complaint, conduct matter or DSI matter with the investigation or investigations of any one or more, or any combination, of the following—
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (i)complaints (whether or not relating to the same conduct),
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (ii)conduct matters, or

Text: (iii)DSI matters,
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: and for splitting a single investigation into two or more separate investigations;”.

Text: (4)In paragraph (j), for “or conduct matter” substitute “ , conduct matter or DSI matter ”.(5)In paragraph (n)(ii), after “recordable conduct matters” insert “ or DSI matters ”.Commencement InformationI326Sch. 12 para. 9 in force at 1.7.2005 by S.I. 2005/1521, art. 3(1)(w)10(1)Section 29 (interpretation) is amended as follows.E+W(2)In subsection (1)—(a)for the definition of “the appropriate authority” substitute—““the appropriate authority”—
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (a)in relation to a person serving with the police or in relation to any complaint, conduct matter or investigation relating to the conduct of such a person, means—
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (i)if that person is a senior officer, the police authority for the area of the police force of which he is a member; and
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (ii)if he is not a senior officer, the chief officer under whose direction and control he is; and
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (b)in relation to a death or serious injury matter, means—
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (i)if the relevant officer is a senior officer, the police authority for the area of the police force of which he is a member; and
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (ii)if he is not a senior officer, the chief officer under whose direction and control he is;”; and
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (b)after the definition of “conduct matter” insert—““death or serious injury matter” and “DSI matter” have the meaning given by section 12;”.
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (3)After subsection (1) insert—“(1A)In this Part “the relevant officer”, in relation to a DSI matter, means the person serving with the police (within the meaning of section 12(7))—
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (a)who arrested the person who has died or suffered serious injury,
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (b)in whose custody that person was at the time of the death or serious injury, or
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (c)with whom that person had the contact in question;
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: and where there is more than one such person it means, subject to subsection (1B), the one who so dealt with him last before the death or serious injury occurred.
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (1B)Where it cannot be determined which of two or more persons serving with the police dealt with a person last before a death or serious injury occurred, the relevant officer is the most senior of them.”
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: Commencement InformationI327Sch. 12 para. 10 in force at 1.7.2005 by S.I. 2005/1521, art. 3(1)(w)11E+WSchedule 3 (handling of complaints and conduct matters) is amended as set out in the following paragraphs.Commencement InformationI328Sch. 12 para. 11 in force at 1.7.2005 by S.I. 2005/1521, art. 3(1)(w)12E+WAfter paragraph 14 insert— “Part 2A E+Whandling of death and serious injury (DSI) matters14ADuty to record DSI matters(1)Where a DSI matter comes to the attention of the police authority or chief officer who is the appropriate authority in relation to that matter, it shall be the duty of the appropriate authority to record that matter.
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (2)If it appears to the Commission—
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (a)that any matter that has come to its attention is a DSI matter, but
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (b)that that matter has not been recorded by the appropriate authority,
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: the Commission may direct the appropriate authority to record that matter; and it shall be the duty of that authority to comply with the direction.
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: 14BDuty to preserve evidence relating to DSI matters(1)Where—
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (a)a DSI matter comes to the attention of a police authority, and
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (b)the relevant officer in relation to that matter is the chief officer of the force maintained by that authority,
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: it shall be the duty of that authority to secure that all such steps as are appropriate for the purposes of Part 2 of this Act are taken, both initially and from time to time after that, for obtaining and preserving evidence relating to that matter.
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (2)Where—
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (a)a chief officer becomes aware of a DSI matter, and
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (b)the relevant officer in relation to that matter is a person under his direction and control,
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: it shall be his duty to take all such steps as appear to him to be appropriate for the purposes of Part 2 of this Act for obtaining and preserving evidence relating to that matter.
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (3)The chief officer's duty under sub-paragraph (2) must be performed as soon as practicable after he becomes aware of the matter in question.
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (4)After that, he shall be under a duty, until he is satisfied that it is no longer necessary to do so, to continue to take the steps from time to time appearing to him to be appropriate for the purposes of Part 2 of this Act for obtaining and preserving evidence relating to the matter.
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (5)It shall be the duty of a police authority to comply with all such directions as may be given to it by the Commission in relation to the performance of any duty imposed on it by virtue of sub-paragraph (1).
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (6)It shall be the duty of the chief officer to take all such specific steps for obtaining or preserving evidence relating to any DSI matter as he may be directed to take for the purposes of this paragraph by the police authority maintaining his force or by the Commission.
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: 14CReference of DSI matters to the Commission(1)It shall be the duty of the appropriate authority to refer a DSI matter to the Commission.
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (2)The appropriate authority must do so within such period as may be provided for by regulations made by the Secretary of State.
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (3)A matter that has already been referred to the Commission under this paragraph on a previous occasion shall not be required to be referred again under this paragraph unless the Commission so directs.
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: 14DDuties of Commission on references under paragraph 14C(1)It shall be the duty of the Commission, in the case of every DSI matter referred to it by a police authority or a chief officer, to determine whether or not it is necessary for the matter to be investigated.
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (2)Where the Commission determines under this paragraph that it is not necessary for a DSI matter to be investigated, it may if it thinks fit refer the matter back to the appropriate authority to be dealt with by that authority in such manner (if any) as that authority may determine.”
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: Commencement InformationI329Sch. 12 para. 12 in force at 1.7.2005 by S.I. 2005/1521, art. 3(1)(w)13E+WIn paragraph 15(1)(a) and (8) (power of the Commission to determine the form of an investigation), for “or recordable conduct matter” substitute “ , recordable conduct matter or DSI matter ”.Commencement InformationI330Sch. 12 para. 13 in force at 1.7.2005 by S.I. 2005/1521, art. 3(1)(w)14(1)Paragraph 16 (investigations by the appropriate authority on its own behalf) is amended as follows.E+W(2)In sub-paragraph (1), for “or recordable conduct matter” substitute “ , recordable conduct matter or DSI matter ”.(3)In sub-paragraph (2)(a), after “recordable conduct matter” insert “ or under paragraph 14D(2) in relation to any DSI matter ”.(4)In sub-paragraph (3), after “(4)” insert “ or (5) ”.(5)In sub-paragraph (4), for “matter” substitute “ conduct matter ”.(6)After sub-paragraph (4) add—“(5)The person appointed under this paragraph to investigate any DSI matter—
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (a)in relation to which the relevant officer is a chief officer, must not be a person under that chief officer's direction and control;
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (b)in relation to which the relevant officer is the Commissioner of Police of the Metropolis or the Deputy Commissioner of Police of the Metropolis, must be the person nominated by the Secretary of State for appointment under this paragraph.”
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: Commencement InformationI331Sch. 12 para. 14 in force at 1.7.2005 by S.I. 2005/1521, art. 3(1)(w)F19315E+W. . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .Textual AmendmentsF193Sch. 12 para. 15 omitted (31.1.2017 for specified purposes, 1.2.2020 in so far as not already in force) by virtue of Policing and Crime Act 2017 (c. 3), s. 183(1)(5)(e), Sch. 5 para. 48(b); S.I. 2020/5, reg. 2(n) (with reg. 3(1)(2)(4))16(1)Paragraph 18 (investigations managed by the Commission) is amended as follows.E+W(2)In sub-paragraph (1), for “or recordable conduct matter” substitute “ , recordable conduct matter or DSI matter ”.F194(3). . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .Textual AmendmentsF194Sch. 12 para. 16(3) omitted (31.1.2017 for specified purposes, 1.2.2020 in so far as not already in force) by virtue of Policing and Crime Act 2017 (c. 3), s. 183(1)(5)(e), Sch. 5 para. 48(b); S.I. 2020/5, reg. 2(n) (with reg. 3(1)(2)(4))Commencement InformationI332Sch. 12 para. 16 in force at 1.7.2005 by S.I. 2005/1521, art. 3(1)(w)17(1)Paragraph 19 (investigations by the Commission itself) is amended as follows.E+W(2)In sub-paragraph (1), for “or recordable conduct matter” substitute “ , recordable conduct matter or DSI matter ”.(3)After sub-paragraph (3) insert—“(3A)The person designated under sub-paragraph (2) to be the person to take charge of an investigation of a DSI matter in relation to which the relevant officer is the Commissioner of Police of the Metropolis or the Deputy Commissioner of Police of the Metropolis must be the person nominated by the Secretary of State to be so designated under that sub-paragraph.”
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: Commencement InformationI333Sch. 12 para. 17 in force at 1.7.2005 by S.I. 2005/1521, art. 3(1)(w)18E+WIn paragraph 20(1) (restrictions on proceedings pending the conclusion of an investigation), after “22” insert “ or 24A ”.Commencement InformationI334Sch. 12 para. 18 in force at 1.7.2005 by S.I. 2005/1521, art. 3(1)(w)F19519E+W. . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .Textual AmendmentsF195Sch. 12 para. 19 omitted (31.1.2017 for specified purposes, 1.2.2020 in so far as not already in force) by virtue of Policing and Crime Act 2017 (c. 3), s. 183(1)(5)(e), Sch. 5 para. 48(b); S.I. 2020/5, reg. 2(n) (with reg. 3(1)(2)(4))20E+WAfter paragraph 21 insert—“21A“Procedure where conduct matter is revealed during investigation of DSI matter(1)If during the course of an investigation of a DSI matter it appears to a person appointed under paragraph 18 or designated under paragraph 19 that there is an indication that a person serving with the police (“the person whose conduct is in question”) may have—
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (a)committed a criminal offence, or
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (b)behaved in a manner which would justify the bringing of disciplinary proceedings,
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: he shall make a submission to that effect to the Commission.
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (2)If, after considering a submission under sub-paragraph (1), the Commission determines that there is such an indication, it shall—
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (a)notify the appropriate authority in relation to the DSI matter and (if different) the appropriate authority in relation to the person whose conduct is in question of its determination; and
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (b)send to it (or each of them) a copy of the submission under sub-paragraph (1).
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (3)If during the course of an investigation of a DSI matter it appears to a person appointed under paragraph 16 or 17 that there is an indication that a person serving with the police (“the person whose conduct is in question”) may have—
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (a)committed a criminal offence, or
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (b)behaved in a manner which would justify the bringing of disciplinary proceedings,
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: he shall make a submission to that effect to the appropriate authority in relation to the DSI matter.
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (4)If, after considering a submission under sub-paragraph (3), the appropriate authority determines that there is such an indication, it shall—
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (a)if it is not the appropriate authority in relation to the person whose conduct is in question, notify that other authority of its determination and send to that authority a copy of the submission under sub-paragraph (3); and
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (b)notify the Commission of its determination and send to it a copy of the submission under sub-paragraph (3).
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (5)Where the appropriate authority in relation to the person whose conduct is in question—
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (a)is notified of a determination by the Commission under sub-paragraph (2),
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (b)(in a case where it is also the appropriate authority in relation to the DSI matter) makes a determination under sub-paragraph (4), or
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (c)(in a case where it is not the appropriate authority in relation to the DSI matter) is notified by that other authority of a determination by it under sub-paragraph (4),
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: it shall record the matter under paragraph 11 as a conduct matter (and the other provisions of this Schedule shall apply in relation to that matter accordingly).”
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: Commencement InformationI335Sch. 12 para. 20 in force at 1.7.2005 by S.I. 2005/1521, art. 3(1)(w)21E+WFor paragraph 22 (final reports on investigations) substitute—“22“Final reports on investigations: complaints, conduct matters and certain DSI matters(1)This paragraph applies on the completion of an investigation of—
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (a)a complaint,
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (b)a conduct matter, or
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (c)a DSI matter in respect of which the Commission or the appropriate authority has made a determination under paragraph 21A(2) or (4).
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (2)A person appointed under paragraph 16 shall submit a report on his investigation to the appropriate authority.
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (3)A person appointed under paragraph 17 or 18 shall—
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (a)submit a report on his investigation to the Commission; and
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (b)send a copy of that report to the appropriate authority.
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (4)In relation to a DSI matter in respect of which a determination has been made under paragraph 21A(2) or (4), the references in sub-paragraphs (2) and (3) of this paragraph to the appropriate authority are references to—
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (a)the appropriate authority in relation to the DSI matter; and
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (b)(where different) the appropriate authority in relation to the person whose conduct is in question.
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (5)A person designated under paragraph 19 as the person in charge of an investigation by the Commission itself shall submit a report on it to the Commission.
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (6)A person submitting a report under this paragraph shall not be prevented by any obligation of secrecy imposed by any rule of law or otherwise from including all such matters in his report as he thinks fit.”
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: Commencement InformationI338Sch. 12 para. 23 in force at 1.7.2005 by S.I. 2005/1521, art. 3(1)(w)24E+WAfter paragraph 24 insert—“24A“Final reports on investigations: other DSI matters(1)This paragraph applies on the completion of an investigation of a DSI matter in respect of which neither the Commission nor the appropriate authority has made a determination under paragraph 21A(2) or (4).
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (2)A person appointed under paragraph 16, 17 or 18 or designated under paragraph 19 shall—
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (a)submit a report on the investigation to the Commission; and
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (b)send a copy of that report to the appropriate authority.
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (3)A person submitting a report under this paragraph shall not be prevented by any obligation of secrecy imposed by any rule of law or otherwise from including all such matters in his report as he thinks fit.
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (4)On receipt of the report, the Commission shall determine whether the report indicates that a person serving with the police may have—
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (a)committed a criminal offence, or
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (b)behaved in a manner which would justify the bringing of disciplinary proceedings.
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: 24BAction by the Commission in response to an investigation report under paragraph 24A(1)If the Commission determines under paragraph 24A(4) that the report indicates that a person serving with the police may have—
Source: Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (c. 15).csv

Text: (a)committed a criminal offence, or

Text: (2)Where the appropriate authority in relation to the person whose conduct is in question is notified of a determination by the Commission under sub-paragraph (1), it shall record the matter under paragraph 11 as a conduct matter (and the other provisions of this Schedule shall apply in relation to that matter accordingly).

requirements in relation to persons serving as park constables with the Royal Parks Constabulary for the purpose of establishing whether they are eligible—(a)to be employed by the Authority, or(b)to employment is terminated under sub-paragraph (1) is not to be treated (whether for the purposes of any enactment or otherwise) as being dismissed by virtue of that termination.Commencement InformationI342Sch. 13 para. 3 in force at 1.7.2005 by S.I. 2005/1521, art. 3(1)(y)Relevant personsE+W4(1)A transfer scheme may provide for any relevant person to become an employee of the Authority effect as the terms and conditions of the relevant person's contract of employment with the Authority,(c)transferring to the Authority the rights, powers, duties and liabilities of the employer under or in connection with the relevant person's Crown employment,(d)for things done before the appointed day by or in relation to the employer in respect of the relevant person or his Crown employment to be treated from that day as having been done by or in relation to the Authority,(e)for the period during which the relevant person has been in Crown employment to count as a period of employment with the Authority (and for the operation of the transfer scheme not to be treated as having interrupted the continuity of that employment), and(f)for the termination of the Crown employment of a relevant person who would otherwise be transferred by the scheme but who has informed the Secretary of State that he does not wish to be so transferred.(3)The scheme may provide for a person who would be
